page.title: 15EGG PRODUCTION RESEARCH
page.content: Lane End Farm Shinfield is part of Reading University.The people who work there are experimenting into increasing egg production. In order to achieve this they are looking into chicken food and lighting patterns.In the unit there are 12 separate rooms each filled with a number of cages.In each cage there is one chicken.The amount and type of food can thus be regulated and recorded in relation to egg production. By keeping the chickens in darkened rooms all the time the scientists are able to control the amount of artificial light allowed to them in each 24 hour period.The scientists have found that by increasing the amount of "daylight" in each 24 hours (thus simulating the longer days of springtime) they are able to increase egg production.
